glsa.title: Lighttpd: Multiple vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Lighttpd, most of them allowing a Denial of Service and potentially the remote execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: Lighttpd is a lightweight HTTP web server.

description.p: Stefan Esser discovered errors with evidence of memory corruption in the code parsing the headers. Several independent researchers also reported errors involving the handling of HTTP headers, the mod_auth and mod_scgi modules, and the limitation of active connections.

impact.p: A remote attacker can trigger any of these vulnerabilities by sending malicious data to the server, which may lead to a crash or memory exhaustion, and potentially the execution of arbitrary code. Additionally, access-deny settings can be evaded by appending a final / to a URL.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
